cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic science analyzes physical evidence as part of its practice.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: An agent examines evidence, data, or other information to extract facts, patterns, or insights.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists collect and analyze evidence.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor examines evidence or data to extract information, patterns, or insights.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in the course of forensic investigations

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists investigate the crime scene by meticulously documenting its details.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Denotes that an investigator examines or investigates a crime scene or context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists reconstruct the actual events that occurred around the crime.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor reconstructs past events or event sequences on the basis of collected evidence and contextual information.

qualifiers.CausalHint: By meticulously documenting... and collecting all relevant evidence
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ReconstructionBasis: crime scene details and collected evidence

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Investigators reconstruct the sequence of events leading up to the crime.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor reconstructs past events or event sequences on the basis of collected evidence and contextual information.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: sequence of events leading up to a crime

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists analyze complex data as part of their role.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: An agent examines evidence, data, or other information to extract facts, patterns, or insights.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An investigative or forensic actor examines evidence, data, or other information to extract facts, patterns, or insights.
args.justification: All three relations describe the same forensic analysis activity: an investigative/forensic actor performing analytical examination of evidence or data. They currently use slightly different canonical descriptions and two different rel_cls values ('forensic_cognitive_activity_relation' and 'forensic_investigation_activity_relation'). Normalizing them under a single canonical description and a more precise, shared class 'forensic_analysis_activity_relation' improves schema consistency while keeping the broad group as AGENCY.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: An investigative or forensic actor examines evidence, data, or other information to extract facts, patterns, or insights.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe the same forensic analysis activity: an investigative/forensic actor performing analytical examination of evidence or data. They currently use slightly different canonical descriptions and two different rel_cls values ('forensic_cognitive_activity_relation' and 'forensic_investigation_activity_relation'). Normalizing them under a single canonical description and a more precise, shared class 'forensic_analysis_activity_relation' improves schema consistency while keeping the broad group as AGENCY.
